title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Venice, LA

content.rendered:
Head to the westmost part of Los Angeles County in California, and you’ll find yourself in Venice. Tourists flock to Venice Beach’s colorful attractions, from its ever-changing art walls, the famous Muscle Beach, to hip Kinney Boulevard. No wonder it’s such a popular location for movies, TV shows, and even video games. Planning a move here and want to know more about the area? In this article, we’ll cover questions like ‘Is Venice, LA, safe?’ and ‘What’s the average rent in Venice?’ Here is everything you need to know as you look for rooms for rent in Venice, LA.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Downtown Los Angeles

Where is Venice, LA?

Venice sits in LA’s urban Westside region, bounded by Santa Monica to the northwest and Culver City to the east. Property developer Abbot Kinney founded Venice in 1905 to turn the beach-front area into a resort town. It was originally called “Venice of America” and considered the “Coney Island of the Pacific” in the early to mid-1900s.

Find Rooms for Rent in Venice, LA

Find Rooms For Rent In Venice, LA

More than 40,000 people call Venice their home. For the most part of the year, you can expect warm, dry summers and cool, wet winters. That’s about 300 days of sunny weather each year. If you love the coast, Venice Beach is an easy five-minute drive away.

Related: A Guide To Renting An Apartment In Los Angeles

Average Rent in Venice

The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in Venice, LA, is lower than in downtown LA or Westwood. You can find more than 6,000 apartments for rent in the area, most of which are one-bedroom units. From affordable rentals, condos, and townhouses, to single-family homes, you’re sure to find an ideal place to move into in Venice.

Here’s a snapshot of the average rent in Venice:

Is Venice, LA, safe?

If you’re new to the area, you may be asking yourself: “Is Venice, LA, safe?” The good news is that while crime rates vary depending on which part of Venice you are in, it’s generally a pretty safe neighborhood.

Naturally, as you look for rooms for rent in Venice, LA, you will want to make sure the place you’re planning to live in is safe and secure. Below are some helpful tools you can use to learn more about the area.

  • AreaVibes: AreaVibes generates a livability score based on a one-of-a-kind algorithm that takes into account a specific location’s qualities. This includes data on its amenities, the cost of living, its employment and safety rates, and the schools in the area. It’s a helpful site to bookmark as you look for rooms for rent in Venice, LA.
  • AroundMe: AroundMe is an app that locates nearby banks, gas stations, or restaurants. It’s a navigation tool that allows you to easily search for relevant establishments in the area.
  • Niche: This app helps connect people to neighborhoods and workplaces. It also has a profile on each college and school in the U.S., making it a go-to resource for families and students searching rooms for rent in Venice, LA.
  • Hotline Numbers: If you feel you are in danger, call 911 or the local emergency number immediately. Some examples of emergencies are a car crash, a crime, a fire, or a medical emergency. For non-emergencies, such as complaints, reporting graffiti or road damage, or simply making an inquiry about a service, call 311 instead.

Public Transit in Venice

1. Walkability

As you look for rooms for rent in Venice, LA, note that it’s Los Angeles’ 17th most walkable neighborhood. Based on this, you may need to use public transportation to get around, but the area is also pretty bicycle-friendly.

2. Roads & Traffic

Just like most of Los Angeles, expect heavy traffic in Venice, which is about two miles from the freeway. Having narrow streets, motorists may find themselves stuck in traffic most of the time. Make sure to plan your journey ahead of time.

3. Nearby Train Stations

The nearest train station to Venice, LA, is the Downtown Santa Monica station. To get to this train station, you could cycle for 13 minutes, walk for 30 minutes, or hop on a “Bird”, an electric scooter that is pretty popular in the area.

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The nearest bus stops in Venice, LA, are on Sunset Avenue and on Brooks Avenue. A bus leaves every seven to eight minutes. Look for the #33 buses. You could also take the Santa Monica Big Blue Bus, which stops at Rose Avenue, Sunset Avenue, and Abbot Kinney.

Restaurants in Venice

No matter what you’re craving, you’re sure to find a restaurant for it in Venice, LA. Restaurants in Venice offer a dizzying array of cuisines, from Indonesian, Italian, Mexican, to All-American. You’ll find most restaurants along Brooks Avenue and Washington Boulevard. Here are a few of the best restaurants in Venice to help you narrow down your options.

1. The Rose Venice

Since 1979, The Rose has been delighting diners with Southern California seasonal offerings and farm-fresh creations. How about some black truffle pappardelle, porchetta, or burrata salad? Enjoy a meal with a friend in their patio area, or find a treat in their full market and bakery. The Rose also has a coffee bar and a craft cocktail bar.

Visit the website
Order now!

2. The Butcher’s Daughter

These days, veganism is taking over. With more people looking for animal product-free options, The Butcher’s Daughter is stepping in. This restaurant has branches in New York and California, offering a variety of plant-based offerings. Each month, they bring in fresh produce and highlight these in their dishes. Customers swear the food is so good that it doesn’t taste plant-based at all.

Visit the website
Order now!

3. Salt & Straw

With LA’s 300 days of sunny weather each year, you can just imagine how refreshing ice cream can be. Salt & Straw’s artisanal and hand-churned ice cream uses milk from hormone and antibiotic-free cows. Plus, they maximize the butterfat content in ice cream for that super smooth, decadent texture. Choose from flavors like salted hazelnut praline s’mores, maple and bacon streusel, mushroom muddy buddies, and more unique offerings.

Visit the website
Order now!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Santa Monica

Parks in Venice

Venice Beach Skate Park: Venice Beach Skate Park, which faces the ocean, opened in 2009. It’s filled with backyard bowls, a sunken pool, and a concrete plaza filled with street art. It’s also an amazing place to watch the sunset.

Linnie Canal Park: Venice, LA, wouldn’t be complete without its signature canals fashioned after the famous ones in Italy. The Linnie Canal Park features a children’s playground as well as a pond. Adults and families enjoy taking strolls around the beautiful canals.

Marine Park: Just off Rose Avenue is Marine Park, which offers a soccer field and baseball, basketball, handball, and tennis courts. Families can also avail themselves of the picnic tables, birthday pavilion, and children’s playground. They also have lots of benches and facilities for visitors.

Venice, LA Grocery Stores

Whole Foods Market: Whole Foods offers natural and organic foods, from produce, pantry essentials, bread, frozen foods, and snacks, to beauty products and supplements. They also provide a variety of options for those on specialized diets like vegan, keto-friendly, and gluten-free. The Venice Beach branch is always fully stocked and the store has super helpful staff.

Website

Erewhon Market: Erewhon Market along Venice Boulevard is a supermarket chain that offers healthy and organic food options, sourced sustainably. Items are a bit pricy, but for the quality of the service and the amazing selection, customers just love it. You also have to try their tonic bar and have their bulletproof and Vittoria organic coffee and kombucha on tap.

Website

Ralphs: Ralphs along Lincoln Boulevard offers in-store shopping, curbside pickup, and delivery. Apart from the usual grocery staples, you can find Halloween, back-to-school, and electronic items here. You can save more when you check out their promos on their website.

Website

We hope this article has helped you learn more about the Venice neighborhood. Taking into account the average rent, as well as the best schools and restaurants in Venice, LA, you’ll surely find this city an exciting place to move to. Happy room hunting!

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Venice, LA? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
